skill.name: test-scaffolding
skill.description: Generate test file scaffolds from source analysis with language-appropriate templates.
skill.summary: Generate test file scaffolds from source analysis with language-appropriate templates.
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure prompt/skill definition containing only markdown documentation and test templates. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access, and no external commands. The skill describes how to scaffold tests but does not execute any operations itself.

content.user_title: Generate test scaffolds for source files
content.value_statement: Writing test files from scratch slows down test-driven development. This skill analyzes your source code and generates test scaffolds with TODO stubs in your preferred framework, so you can focus on implementing tests instead of setting them up.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes source files to extract public functions, classes, and methods
Detects test framework from project manifest files
Generates test scaffolds with TODO stubs for test-engineer agents
Supports 6 languages: Python, TypeScript, JavaScript, Go, Rust, Dart
Applies language-specific naming conventions and import patterns
Returns JSON manifest with generated files and unit counts
limitations: Does not execute tests or run test frameworks
Requires an AI agent to read source files and apply templates
Scaffolds are starting points that need human or agent implementation
Framework detection requires package manifest files

use_cases.title: Accelerate TDD workflows
use_cases.description: Quickly generate test scaffolds so you can focus on implementing test logic instead of setup.

use_cases.title: Enable automated testing
use_cases.description: Agents use this skill to auto-populate tests for owned files during lane execution.

use_cases.title: Standardize test patterns
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent test file structure across your codebase with framework-specific templates.

prompt_templates.title: Basic scaffold request
prompt_templates.prompt: Use test-scaffolding skill to generate test scaffolds for src/auth/login.py and src/auth/user.ts. Use pytest for Python. Output to tests/auth/.

prompt_templates.title: Framework specification
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate test scaffolds for src/utils/calculator.ts using Vitest framework. Include fixture stubs. Output to tests/unit/utils/.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-file batch
prompt_templates.prompt: Use test-scaffolding to analyze src/api/ directory. Generate test scaffolds for all TypeScript files with Jest framework. Skip files with existing tests.

prompt_templates.title: Integration with plan
prompt_templates.prompt: From the plan output, identify files marked as Tests Owned. Generate test scaffolds for those files using the detected framework. Return the scaffold manifest.

output_examples.input: Generate test scaffolds for src/auth/login.py with pytest
output: Scaffold contains TODO stubs ready for test implementation

best_practices: Use TODO stubs so AI agents can detect and fill in test implementations
Apply framework detection automatically from project manifests
Mirror source directory structure in test directories for clarity
Skip files with existing tests to avoid duplicate work
anti_patterns: Manually creating test files from scratch instead of using scaffolds
Overwriting existing test files without checking for changes
Using skip markers instead of TODO comments for unimplemented tests
Ignoring framework-specific conventions for naming and imports

faq.question: Which languages and frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Python (pytest, unittest), TypeScript/JavaScript (Vitest, Jest), Go (testing), Rust (cargo test), Dart (flutter_test, test).

faq.question: What is the maximum number of test units per scaffold?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. The skill extracts all public symbols. Very large files may trigger performance warnings.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with other AI Dev Kit skills?
faq.answer: Yes. It integrates with plan-phase to populate test columns and execute-lane to scaffold tests before test-engineer runs.

faq.question: Is my source code sent to external services?
faq.answer: No. This skill is a prompt definition. The AI agent reads your files locally. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: What if the skill cannot detect my framework?
faq.answer: You must specify the framework explicitly using the TEST_FRAMEWORK variable. Without a manifest, detection fails.

faq.question: How does this compare to other test generation tools?
faq.answer: Unlike code-generation tools that write full tests, this skill creates scaffolds with TODO stubs for iterative TDD workflows.
